description: Skills for home cooking education — from kitchen safety and tool identification to meal planning and recipe creation. Designed for homeschool families, community cooking classes, and family education programs.

setting_constraints.environment: kitchen — home or community kitchen with standard residential equipment
setting_constraints.connectivity: optional — recipes can be printed; no internet required during cooking
setting_constraints.materials: kitchen equipment — knives, cutting boards, pots/pans, oven, measuring tools, staple ingredients
setting_constraints.safety: age-appropriate supervision required, burn prevention, knife safety, allergen awareness, food temperature monitoring
setting_constraints.allergen_protocol: always check for allergies before any tasting or cooking activity; maintain allergen-free alternatives

skills.label: Can identify and name common kitchen tools: chef's knife, paring knife, cutting board, whisk, spatula, measuring cups/spoons, thermometer
Can demonstrate safe kitchen practices: hand washing, handling hot surfaces, preventing cross-contamination, fire safety
Can accurately measure dry and liquid ingredients using cups, spoons, and a kitchen scale
Can safely hold a knife and perform basic cuts: rough chop, dice, mince, and slice with consistent size
Can manage stovetop temperature: adjust between low/medium/high, recognize when oil shimmers vs smokes, maintain a simmer vs boil
Can use a thermometer to check food doneness and explain safe internal temperatures for meat, poultry, and leftovers
Can read a recipe, identify ingredients and steps, and follow it sequentially from start to finish
Can sauté vegetables and proteins: manage oil temperature, avoid overcrowding the pan, achieve browning without burning
Can prepare a basic sauce: pan sauce, vinaigrette, or roux-based sauce with correct consistency
Can cook rice, pasta, and other grains to proper doneness using correct water ratios and timing
Can prepare a simple dough (bread, pizza, or biscuit): mix, knead, and recognize proper texture and elasticity
Can taste a dish and adjust salt, acid, fat, and heat to improve flavor balance
Can identify the five basic tastes (salt, sweet, sour, bitter, umami) and common herbs/spices by smell and taste
Can organize ingredients and tools before cooking: read recipe fully, prep all ingredients, arrange workspace efficiently
Can double, halve, or scale a recipe for a different number of servings while maintaining correct proportions
Can evaluate a finished dish on taste, texture, appearance, and temperature, and identify what went wrong if it failed
Can prepare a complete meal with protein, starch, and vegetable, timing all components to finish together
Can modify a recipe to accommodate dietary restrictions (gluten-free, dairy-free, vegetarian) while preserving flavor and texture
Can design a balanced weekly meal plan considering nutrition, budget, dietary restrictions, ingredient reuse, and prep time
